[CCS99] Cohen, A. M., Cuypers, H., and Sterk, H., Algebra interactive!, Springer-Verlag, Berlin (1999), viii+159 pages
(Learning algebra in an exciting way, With 1 CD-ROM (Windows, LINUX and UNIX)).

[H09] Holt, D. F., \it Theory of finite simple groups [book review of MR2266036], Bull. Amer. Math. Soc. (N.S.), 46 (1) (2009), 151–156.

[HH03] Hunter, D. J. and von Hippel, P. T., How rare is symmetry in musical 12-tone rows?, Amer. Math. Monthly, 110 (2) (2003), 124–132.

[JKT04] Joyner, D., Kreminski, R., and Turisco, J., Applied abstract algebra, Johns Hopkins University Press, Baltimore, MD (2004), xii+329 pages.

[M15] Martin, U., Stumbling around in the dark: lessons from everyday mathematics, in Automated deduction—CADE 25, Springer, Cham, Lecture Notes in Comput. Sci., 9195 (2015), 29–51.

[P17] Peck, R. W., Almost difference sets in transformational music theory, in Mathematics and computation in music, Springer, Cham, Lecture Notes in Comput. Sci., 10527 (2017), 63–75.
